intro: Lasiophyton pusillum, commonly known as the small-stemmed clubmoss, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, scale-like leaves that are tightly arranged around the stem. The plant produces spore-bearing cones, which are typically clustered at the base of the stem. Lasiophyton pusillum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky crevices. Its simple structure and ancient lineage make it an important subject in the study of early plant evolution.
